chargeHist.descr: Neglecting a Child (No Harm and Child < 6 Yrs or Disability)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan Scott Williams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Neglecting a Child (No Harm and Child < 6 Yrs or Disability) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant to undergo any counseling recommendations by DOC

9:28 AM Defendant Ryan Scott Williams in court.  Attorney Michael Yang in court for Ryan Scott Williams.  Prosecuting attorney Margeret Anne Sorrentino in court for the State of Wisconsin. Waiver of Right to Prelim filed, Court accepts Waiver, probable cause found, bound over, Information filed, waives reading, Rights/Elements, Defendant pleads no contest to Ct. 3, Court finds defendant guilty, Judgment to be entered,  Ct. 1 and Ct. 2 dismissed, read in, Court withholds sentence, probation 2 years, $518.00 costs, Defendant to undergo any counseling recommendations by DOC, Defendant to submit DNA Sample, no sentence credit at this time, there are potentially 8 days of credit if defendant is revoked, 9:50 A.M.
